document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 29–34. Dolichogyna abrupta Hine, 1914: (29) female, head and (30) female, dorsal view. Dolichogyna chilensis Walker, 1836: (31) male, head and (32) male, dorsal view- Dolichogyna hinei Fluke, 1957: (33) female, head and (34) female, dorsal view. All photos by Vicente Valdés. All scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Chiloé , Chile ” (T, A, BMNH )
.

World distribution. Argentina , Ecuador , Peru and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Arica y Parinacota to Magallanes region ( Fig. 39 ).

Biology and notes. Fluke (1951) indicates that
Dolichogyna chilensis
is a native species that also inhabits Argentina and Peru .
Marín-Armijos et al. (2017)
also recorded it in Ecuador . The species visits flowers of
Tepualia stipularis (Hook & Arn.) Griseb.
, (
Smith-Ramírez et al. , 2005
) as well as other herbaceous plants, exotic and native trees such as
E. cordifolia
(R. Barahona-Segovia, pers. obs.). This species has also been recorded visiting the exotic
Brassica rapa
L. (Ricardo Huenuanca, CSP record);
Euryops pectinatus
(L.) Cass. (Gustavo Lezana, Norka Contreras, Peter Lewis and Yanira Venegas CSP records);
Prunus
sp. (Frank Montes, CSP record),
Taraxacum officinale
L. (Patricia Medina, CSP record),
Ranunculus
sp. (Norka Contreras, CSP record) and the native shrubs as
Berberis
sp. (Fernando González, CSP record) or
Buddleja globossa Hope
(Manuel Gedda, CSP record).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 690,143 km 2 ; AOO = 112 km 2 , 24 subpopulations and 26 localities.
